stepTitle: Potassium atoms in a flame emit light as they undergo transitions from one energy level to another that is $$4.9{10}^{\left(-19\right)} J$$ lower in energy. Calculate the wavelength in nm of the light emitted. $$E = \frac{hc}{\lambda}$$, $$J = kg m^2 s^{\left(-2\right)}$$, $$c = 3{10}^8 \frac{m}{s}$$, $$h = 6.626\times {10}^{\left(-34\right)}$$ $$J s$$. Please round to 2 decimal places.
